location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in this file are arranged chronologically. There are file notes at the end of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. Two additional foliation sequences are also present in parallel between ff 2-102 and ff 103-119 respectively.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence concerning the activities of German shipping in the Persian Gulf.Topics discussed include:the use of the Hansa line to transport materials for the Bahrain Petroleum Company (ff 2-14);activities of German nationals, Heinrich Willnow and Reinhard Kulenkampff (ff.16-56);parallels with German activities before the First World War (f 28);a system for tracking German ships in the Gulf (f 58);German anti-British and pro-Iraqi propaganda in 1939 (f 91).Correspondents include Percy Gordon Loch, Political Agent, Bahrain; Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser, Bahrain Government; and Lieutenant-Colonel Trenchard Craven Fowle, Political Resident Persian Gulf.
